alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 1:52PM MST until August 01 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County near Prescott in west central Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 151 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott, Prescott Valley, Oak Knoll Village, Ponderosa Park, Groom Creek Subdivision, White Spar Campground, Lower Wolf Creek Campground, Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground and Lynx Lake Dam. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 293 and 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 304 and 315. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Skull Valley Wash, Granite Creek, Lynx Creek, Spence Creek, Miller Creek, Copper Basin Wash, Wolf Creek, Butte Creek, Mint Wash, Bannon Creek, Iron Springs Wash, Hassayampa River and Willow Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
